description: Christian Democrats deputy group chairman Jan Bartosek said Russians should resolve their disputes at home and not at their embassy in Czechia, adding that he would be glad if BIS director Michal Koudelka joined the Chamber of Deputies security committee meeting and briefed the deputies on the reasons for the expulsion. Civic Democrats deputy chairman...
text:
Prague, June 5 (CTK) - Czech opposition representatives say the expulsion of
two Russian diplomats is an appropriate reaction and believe that the embassy
staff should be further reduced, they told journalists today.

The opposition representatives welcomed the work of the counter-intelligence
service (BIS).

According to the Ria Novosti Russian news agency, Russian Deputy Vladimir
Djabarov said Russia will react to the Czech decision soon.

The case was made up within a dispute between the Russian embassy employees,
one of whom sent false information to Czech secret services, PM Babis (ANO)
and Foreign Minister Tomas Petricek (Social Democrats, CSSD) told journalists
today.

Christian Democrats (KDU-CSL) deputy group chairman Jan Bartosek said Russians
should resolve their disputes at home and not at their embassy in Czechia,
adding that he would be glad if BIS director Michal Koudelka joined the
Chamber of Deputies security committee meeting and briefed the deputies on the
reasons for the expulsion.

Communists (KSCM) chairman Vojtech Filip said he does not have access to any
documents detailing the incident and that he cannot confirm or deny if the
whole case was a game played by foreign powers.

Civic Democrats (ODS) deputy chairman Martin Kupka said the incident confirms
the suspicion that the Russian embassy is a security risk for the Czech
Republic.

Pirates deputy Jan Lipavsky said he agrees that the Czech reaction was
adequate and strong, adding that the Czech-Russian relations are now in crisis
and that the mutual communication between the countries is not good enough.

Mayors and Independents (STAN) chairman Vit Rakusan said he is glad that Czech
diplomacy is not afraid to take such decisive steps.

TOP 09 chairwoman Marketa Pekarova Adamova said she agrees with the decision
and that she hopes that it was just the first step, adding that she hopes that
the number of employees at the Russian embassy will be reduced as soon as
possible.

title: Opposition says expulsion of two Russian diplomats is appropriate
html:
Prague, June 5 (CTK) - Czech opposition representatives say the expulsion of two Russian diplomats is an appropriate reaction and believe that the embassy staff should be further reduced, they told journalists today.

The opposition representatives welcomed the work of the counter-intelligence service (BIS).

According to the Ria Novosti Russian news agency, Russian Deputy Vladimir Djabarov said Russia will react to the Czech decision soon.

The case was made up within a dispute between the Russian embassy employees, one of whom sent false information to Czech secret services, PM Babis (ANO) and Foreign Minister Tomas Petricek (Social Democrats, CSSD) told journalists today.
